intro: Dysoxylum quaifei, commonly known as the New Zealand hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces woody capsules as fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal and lowland areas, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Dysoxylum quaifei is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
